direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods deal with attribute presence and retrieval, but one returns the attribute value while the other returns a boolean indicating presence.
Both methods handle attribute retrieval, but 'attr' returns the first matching attribute value, while 'eachAttr' returns a list of all matching attribute values.
Both methods interact with attributes, but 'attr' retrieves the attribute value, while 'removeAttr' removes the attribute from the elements.
Both methods modify element attributes, but 'attr' retrieves or sets a specific attribute, while 'addClass' modifies the class attribute.
Both methods modify element attributes, but 'attr' retrieves or sets a specific attribute, while 'removeClass' modifies the class attribute.
Both methods modify element attributes, but 'attr' retrieves or sets a specific attribute, while 'toggleClass' modifies the class attribute.
Both methods interact with attributes, but 'attr' retrieves the attribute value, while 'hasClass' checks for the presence of a class in the class attribute.
Both methods retrieve values from elements, but 'attr' retrieves a specific attribute value, while 'val' retrieves the form element's value.
Both methods retrieve content from elements, but 'attr' retrieves an attribute value, while 'text' retrieves the combined text content.
Both methods retrieve content from elements, but 'attr' retrieves an attribute value, while 'html' retrieves the combined inner HTML.
Both methods retrieve content from elements, but 'attr' retrieves an attribute value, while 'outerHtml' retrieves the combined outer HTML.
Both methods modify element attributes, but 'attr' retrieves or sets a specific attribute, while 'tagName' modifies the tag name.
Both methods modify element content, but 'attr' retrieves or sets a specific attribute, while 'html' sets the inner HTML.
Both methods modify element content, but 'attr' retrieves or sets a specific attribute, while 'prepend' adds HTML to the start of the inner HTML.
Both methods modify element content, but 'attr' retrieves or sets a specific attribute, while 'append' adds HTML to the end of the inner HTML.
Both methods modify element content, but 'attr' retrieves or sets a specific attribute, while 'before' inserts HTML before the element's outer HTML.
Both methods modify element content, but 'attr' retrieves or sets a specific attribute, while 'after' inserts HTML after the element's outer HTML.
Both methods modify element content, but 'attr' retrieves or sets a specific attribute, while 'wrap' wraps HTML around each element.
Both methods modify element structure, but 'attr' retrieves or sets a specific attribute, while 'unwrap' removes the matched elements but keeps their children.
Both methods modify element content, but 'attr' retrieves or sets a specific attribute, while 'empty' removes all child nodes from each matched element.
Both methods modify element structure, but 'attr' retrieves or sets a specific attribute, while 'remove' removes each matched element from the DOM.
